author: FPJ Online Edit
content: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who is gearing up for the release of Yodha, visited Kashi Vishwanath temple and Kaal Bhairav temple in Varanasi to seek blessings on the occasion of Mahashivratri. Pictures and videos of the actor from the temple have surfaced on social media. In a now-viral video, Sidharth is seen offering prayers and performing a puja
title: Video: Sidharth visits Kashi Vishwanath ahead of Yodha release

author: The Hawk Editor
content: At the Billboard Women in Music Awards, Kylie Minogue, having released her 16th album "Tension" and hit single "Padam Padam," shared her mantra: "Just be you." Awarded the Icon Award, she reflected on her journey, emphasizing authenticity and gratitude. Celebrating a career peak, she cherishes the multigenerational connection her music brings.
title: Kylie Minogue inspires women: 'Be the Best You'

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: Superstar Ajith Kumar has been hospitalised for a nerve swelling treatment in Chennai. Reacting to his health rumours, the actor's spokesperson said that he will not undergo a brain surgery. "There was swelling in the nerve connecting his ear to the brain. Doctors got rid of it with a simple medical procedure. Ajith is fine," the spokesperson told Zoom
title: Ajith hospitalised for nerve swelling treatment in Chennai: Report

author: Ishita Gupta
content: Renowned poet Sahir Ludhianvi's life is a saga of resilience and artistry. He faced many societal challenges yet his poetry resonated with universal themes of love, humanity, and social justice. From struggling student to revered lyricist, Sahir's journey embodies the transformative power of words. His legacy lives on, immortalized in timeless verses that continue to inspire generations.
title: “mein pal do pal ka shayar hun”- Sahir Ludhianvi

author: Farida
content: Alia Bhatt celebrates International Women's Day with a heartfelt Instagram post, sharing a red heart-shaped toy. Speculation arises whether her daughter, Raha, crafted it. Comments express skepticism over a toddler's ability. Last November marked Raha's first birthday, celebrated with joy by parents Alia and Ranbir Kapoor. Ranbir was recently seen with Raha at cousin Jeh's birthday party.
title: Alia Shares Toy Crafted by Her “Little Woman”; Internet Skeptical

author: Dharini Mudgal
content: Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently opened up about her year-long break from acting to recover from the autoimmune disease myositis. She said, "It was the best decision because there's no way I'd have been able to continue working." She added, "The stress of work, coupled with the condition, is not...easiest thing to handle. I'm...glad that I gave myself time to recover."
title: It was the best decision: Samantha on year-long break from acting

author: Sudipto
content: Connected to India caught up with the cast of Khichdi 2: Mission Paanthukistan, comprising Supriya Pathak Kapur (Hansa Praful Parekh), Anang Desai (Tulsidas Parekh/Babuji) and Jamnadas Majethia (Himanshu Chandrakant Sheth), for Spotlight. Emphasising on the importance of Khichdi, Supriya Pathak said, When you need certain things, you go back to your origins and for us, Khichdi is our origin.
title: WATCH: Exclusive interview with Khichdi 2 cast

author: Udit Gupta
content: A video of Gauahar Khan scolding paparazzi at the screening of Ajay Devgn, R Madhavan and Jyotika's 'Shaitaan' in Mumbai has surfaced online. In the clip, the actress was seen losing her cool while posing for them. "Kaise baat karte ho aap log? You should learn how to talk," Gauahar was heard telling them.
title: You should learn how to talk: Gauahar Khan as she scolds paparazzi

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Yami Gautam's film "Article 370" emerges as a super hit, garnering ₹61.91 crore by Week 2. With controlled costs and robust theatrical performance, it sees steady weekday earnings and anticipates growth over the Maha Shivratri holiday. The film's success underscores the power of impactful storytelling and efficient cost management in the industry.
title: Yami Gautam’s Article 370 surpasses expectations, Totaling 61.91Cr

author: Bhawana Chaudhary
content: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, during a podcast by Navya Naveli Nanda, said the older generation was less stressed and anxious because there was no internet. "We hadn't heard of an anxiety attack when we were kids...we never heard it in our midlife also," she said. Jaya further said anxiety happens because the youth is constantly being fed information.
title: Never heard of anxiety as kids, it happens due to internet: Jaya
